'''Exploud''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''バクオング''' ''Bakuong'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Loudred}} starting at [[level]] 40. It is the final form of {{p|Whismur}}.

==Biology==
Exploud is a blue, bipedal Pokémon with a large mouth. It has red eyes, a stubby nose, and two peg-like teeth in each jaw. It has protruding tubes with holes along its body: seven forming a crest on top of its head, one on each elbow and knee, two along its back, and one at the end of each of its two tails. The tubes along its head-crest and tails are tipped with yellow, while the ones along its back have yellow semicircular patterns on either sides. There are two yellow semicircle markings on its belly, but they are rarely seen due to its giant mouth. Its arms have three thin stripes below its elbow and three fingers. Each foot has four claws, three in the front and one in the back, and a yellow paw pad.

Exploud's uses the tubes on its body to draw in air and increase its noise-based attacks. Its bellowing is capable of triggering earthquakes and can be heard from over six miles away. While it only raises its voice when it is in battle, it can also communicate its feelings to others by producing whistle-like sounds. It lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Cave Pokémon|caves}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Exploud anime.png|thumb|220px|left|Exploud in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Exploud debuted in ''[[AG066|Exploud and Clear]]'', evolving from {{OBP|Guy|AG066}}'s {{p|Loudred}}. After it evolved, it disobeyed and then left its {{pkmn|Trainer}}. Later in the episode, {{TRT}} tried to kidnap Exploud. When Exploud saw Guy defending it, it began to listen to him once again.

An Exploud appeared in ''[[AG086|Lights, Camerupt, Action!]]'', where it played the role of a villain in a [[Movies in the Pokémon world|movie]] that [[Elijah]] and his {{p|Camerupt}} were delivering to a small village.

An Exploud appeared in ''[[PK17|Pikachu's Island Adventure]]'' along with a {{p|Hariyama}}. Both were members of a gang led by {{MTR}}.

Two Exploud appeared in ''[[M12|Arceus and the Jewel of Life]]'', under the ownership of [[Damos]].

An Exploud appeared in ''[[BW139|Team Rocket's Shocking Recruit!]]'', where it was causing trouble for Team Rocket.

An Exploud appeared in ''[[XY045|Splitting Heirs!]]'', under the ownership of [[Blake and Heath's parents|Blake and Heath's father]].

===Minor appearances===
A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Exploud appeared in ''[[DP061|Team Shocker!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Appeal|Performance Stage]] of the {{to|Solaceon}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

An Exploud appeared in ''[[XY019|A Conspiracy to Conquer!]]'', in which it was being possessed by an evil, psychopathic {{DL|Recurring wild Pokémon in the anime|Malamar}}.

An Exploud appeared in the Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures short ''{{DL|Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures|Wake Up}}''.

An image of an Exploud appeared in ''[[XY091|A Performance Pop Quiz!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Exploud Loudred Hyper Voice Adventures 1.png|thumb|Exploud (middle) in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Arceus and the Jewel of Life manga===
In the manga adaption for ''{{ma|Arceus and the Jewel of Life}}'', [[Marcus]] owned an Exploud and along with his other Pokémon, he used them to attack and weaken {{mov|Arceus|Arceus|12}}.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS219|What Would You Do for a Whismur?]]'', two {{p|Loudred}} and an Exploud were called by the {{p|Whismur}} that were disturbed by [[Team Magma]]'s attack at [[Rusturf Tunnel]]. They disbanded the troublemakers using {{m|Hyper Voice}}.

==Trivia==
* Prior to Generation VI, Exploud's base stats were all 20 higher than its {{p|Loudred|pre-evolution}}.

===Origin===
Exploud shares some features with a {{wp|pipe organ}}, a musical instrument known for its loud volume.

====Name origin====
Exploud is a combination of ''explode'' and ''loud''.

Bakuong may be a combination of 爆音 ''bakuon'' (the sound of an explosion) and 音楽 ''ongaku'' (music).
